humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there are metastases in 4 out of 7 assessed lymph nodes (B. 'RIGHT BREAST', (MASTECTOMY WITH AXILLARY TAIL) : AXILLARY LYMPH NODES. METASTATIC CARCINOMA IN 4 OF 7 LYMPH NODES). Based on the new rules provided, this corresponds to N1 (N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions 'Metastatic carcinoma in 4 of 7 lymph nodes' which indicates that the cancer has spread to level I or II axillary lymph nodes. This corresponds to an N1 stage. The presence of extracapsular spread and the largest lymph node being 2.1 cm in size do not affect the N stage in this case.
